title: Hot Pepper

verbs: To heat, or to become hot
nouns: A variety of chili pepper having a conical shape and a bitter and burning taste, Capsicum frutescens variety tabasco.
The tabasco pepper is a variety of chili pepper species Capsicum frutescens.
A variety of the chili pepper species Capsicum frutescens.
Capsicum frutescens is a species of chili pepper that is sometimes considered to be part of the species Capsicum annuum.
Plant bearing very hot medium-sized oblong red peppers; grown principally in the Gulf Coast states for production of hot sauce
Any substance consumed to provide nutritional support for the body. For prepared ready-to-eat food, use dish: Q746549.
Any substance consumed by living organisms to sustain life.
Any substance that can be consumed by living organisms, especially by eating, in order to sustain life.
Any solid substance (as opposed to liquid) that is used as a source of nourishment
Food is any substance consumed to provide nutritional support for the body.

description: A bright red Mexican chili pepper, slightly curled and with a green stem. May be used to represent something “hot and spicy,” figuratively or literally, as a dish on a restaurant menu.
apple_vendor_description: The hot pepper emoji on Apple devices is a vibrant, glossy red, shaped with the characteristic curve of a ripe chili pepper. Apple's design language imbues it with a realistic texture and subtle highlights, suggesting its fiery flavor and heat. This emoji is commonly used to convey spiciness in food descriptions, or metaphorically to express something exciting, intense, or even a bit dangerous.
